SENT.plain: Sympathetic storms (SyS) are characterized by hyperactivity of autonomic functions, resulting in episodes of hyperthermia, hypertension, tachycardia, and hyperhidrosis
We show here a patient with neuro-BehÃ§et's disease (NBD) complicated by SyS

Although SyS is well known to occur with brain tumors, trauma, and hydrocephalus, this is the first report to show that SyS is a manifestation of central nervous system involvement in a patient with NBD
High concentrations of norepinephrine (NE) and IL-8 in cerebrospinal fluid reflected the activity of SyS
The patient's symptoms showed almost complete improvement after treatment with corticosteroids and intravenous cyclophosphamide
Also, the concentrations of NE and IL-8 were decreased to normal levels
An awareness of the potential for SyS and adequate immunosuppressant therapy are of importance when dealing with patients with NBD
